db:abstract.db:para: The QSGBasicGeometryNode class serves as a baseclass for geometry based nodes.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QSGBasicGeometryNode class should not be used by itself. It is only encapsulates shared functionality between the QSGGeometryNode and QSGClipNode classes.

db:note.db:para: All classes with QSG prefix should be used solely on the scene graph's rendering thread. See Scene Graph and Rendering for more information.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QSGBasicGeometryNode::~QSGBasicGeometryNode()
db:section.db:para: If the node has the flag QSGNode::OwnsGeometry set, it will also delete the geometry object it is pointing to. This flag is not set by default.

db:section.db:title: QSGGeometry *QSGBasicGeometryNode::geometry()
db:section.db:para: The geometry is null by default.

db:section.db:title: const QSGGeometry *QSGBasicGeometryNode::geometry() const
db:section.db:para: The geometry is null by default.

db:section.db:title: void QSGBasicGeometryNode::setGeometry(QSGGeometry *geometry)
db:section.db:para: Sets the geometry of this node to geometry.
If the node has the flag QSGNode::OwnsGeometry set, it will also delete the geometry object it is pointing to. This flag is not set by default.
If the geometry is changed whitout calling setGeometry() again, the user must also mark the geometry as dirty using QSGNode::markDirty().
